channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Community hall bin not emptied for 3 weeks, 24th November
item.description:
The Coldharbour Community Hall bin hasn't been collected for 3 weeks. This is not the first time, I have had to run across the road to tell them. They tell me it gets collected every week which is not true and I hate council staff lie to me when they keep driving past when I'm there. Please can you get your staff to collect every week after they do the Nisa store across the road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): William Barefoot Drive, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loading Parking Bay, 24th November
item.description:
I’m work at the Co Op, we have a parking bay in front that we are constantly having to wait to use because we have vehicles constantly unlawfully parked there. Which has lead to us having to cancel deliveries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Denmark Hill, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working again!, 24th November
item.description:
The street lights are not working, the darker evenings and no lighting this is such a health and safety hazard. This has been happening at least once a month since August. The issue needs to be looked into properly and resolved.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Derrick Gardens, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out and broken top - 66 Belgrave Road, 24th November
item.description:
It was marked as fixed, as it did come on, but is now off again. Has been broken for >1 month. The top also seems to be broken. thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, City of Westminster

item.title: Your cleaner keeps leaving trolly, 24th November
item.description:
Your street cleaner leaves his trolley on on property for 2 hours at a time. This is not a one time thing and happens regular like is being hidden out of sight for a few hours. Please stop this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Homesdale Road, Widmore, Greater London

This van was dumped in the street two months ago. Hasn’t moved and isn’t taxed

item.title: Glass on street outside Brotherhood of the Cross & Star and private bin area, 24th November
item.description:
On County Street, opposite Brotherhood of Cross and Star building, the bin area for Tavern Court appears to have waste dumped from externally. The access gate is normally unlocked to allow bin collection weekly, and it appears someone has gained access illegally. Glass can be seen on the street from where the materials appear to have been dragged in. We do not have evidence of anyone seeing the act, but sounds were heard late on the evening of 9-November. On the 24th of November, similar type of glass was noted to have been dumped right outside the pavement of the Brotherhood of the Cross and Star. Unfortunately this is being dumped overnight and appears to be a deliberate act of fly tipping

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): County Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags and litter on Tabard street, 24th November
item.description:
There are rubbish bags and litter next to the planters on Tabard Street. It was reported 24 hours ago and fixmystreet stated it had been cleared. However, the rubbish bags and litter has not been cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chair dumped on Tabard Street, 24th November
item.description:
There is a chair dumped at the tree on Tabard Street. It was reported two days ago and fixmystreet stated it has been removed. However, the chair is still there today - five days later. It still needs to be removed by Southwark Council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London

item.title: Gaude Road is an unsafe road, 24th November
item.description:
This was reported weeks ago. Wheelchair users cannot use the path, pavement or street. The street is full of rubbish and leaves. No cleaners attend the street or ever clean this street. This is a public health issue I will contact my MP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gauden Road, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parked illegally daily, 24th November
item.description:
The same vehicle has been parking on an unmarked illegal parking space in flintmill cresent for the past month on a weekly basis. The van was reported but no action was taken . It’s a great dark grey transit with a cab with blacked out windows . The van also has NO M.O.T . This van blocks a pedestrian pathway way restricting wheelchair/pushchair access. And does this on a daily basis . Action is required.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Flintmill Crescent, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ashfield parade illegal parking problem, 24th November
item.description:
Around Ashfield parade there is a continuous illegal parking problem causing a great deal of distress for local residents; This problem seems to be caused by non-nationals illegally parking: 1. On the taxi rank 2. On corners causing obstructions and bottlenecks to traffic flow 3. No traffic enforcement is in effect whatsoever 4. Double yellow lines must be painted on all the corners and bends on and around Ashfield parade and surrounding roads; 5. The taxi rank is of no use to taxi's and is being used soley as car parking by non-national tradesmen; 6. Why is this problem being ignored ??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-16, Burleigh Gardens, Brunswick Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 7 camden mews, 24th November
item.description:
The streetlight outside number 7 camden mews is not working, making the whole street incredibly dark. It feels unsafe and unsettling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-5, Camden Mews, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
